title: ESA and GSMA Foundry empower industry to achieve seamless global connectivity
summary: At MWC25 Barcelona, the European Space Agency (ESA) unveiled a funding initiative, promoted in partnership with GSMA Foundry, to support projects aimed at integrating satellite and terrestrial networks for seamless connectivity.

title: The ART of training – part two
summary: ESA’s second group of Astronaut Reserve members has successfully completed the first block of their intensive Astronaut Reserve Training (ART) programme. Starting in January 2025, four members of the European Astronaut Reserve—Meganne Christian from the UK, Anthea Comellini from Italy, John McFall from the UK and Carmen Possnig from Austria— tarted their two months training programme at ESA’s European Astronaut Centre (EAC) in Cologne, Germany, honing essential skills required for future space exploration and scientific research.

title: Starship Flight 8: SpaceX nails Super Heavy booster catch but loses upper stage
summary:
Flight 8 ended with mixed results as SpaceX nailed another Super Heavy Booster catch and the upper stage experienced a rapid unscheduled disassembly.

title: Intuitive Machines lunar lander healthy, but apparently on its side
summary: A commercially built moon lander built by Houston-based Intuitive Machines landed near the moon's south pole Thursday, but telemetry indicated it ended up on its side. The lander is "alive," officials said, but it's not yet known what mission objectives might still be met.

title: Starship upper stage lost in second mishap in a row
summary: SpaceX launched its huge Starship rocket on the program's eighth test flight Thursday, but a malfunction of some sort triggered multiple upper stage engine shutdowns and for the second flight in a row, the vehicle failed to reach its planned sub-orbital altitude and broke apart in a shower of debris.
